resources.string: Since 1992, AVI has been a biannual appointment for a wide international community of experts with a broad range of backgrounds. Through out more than two decades, the Conference has attracted leading researchers of Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) from all over the world, offering a forum to present and disseminate new technological results, new paradigms, new visions for HCI and user interfaces. Because of advanced technology and new possibilities for user interaction, AVI has broadened the topics it covers, still keeping its main focus on the conception, design, implementation and evaluation of novel visual interfaces. While routed in Italy, AVI is a true international conference with respect to nationality of participants, authors of papers and program committee members. The mixture of carefully selected research contributions paired with cordial Italian hospitality creates a unique conference atmosphere, which has made AVI an internationally recognized brand. Traditionally, AVI has been in cooperation with ACM SIGCHI and AVI proceedings have been published by ACM Press and available in the ACM Digital Library. For AVI 2016 the in cooperation status with ACM SIGCHI, SIGMM, SIGWEB is pending. Past editions of AVI:

array.name: Paolo_Buono
array.item: Dipartimento di Informatica, Università degli Studi di Bari Aldo Moro, Via Orabona, 4 - 70125 Bari, Italy

array.name: Maristella_Matera
array.item: Dipartimento di Elettronica, Informazione e Bioingegneria (DEIB), Politecnico di Milano, Via Ponzio, 34/5, 20133 - Milano, Italy

resources.string:
The edition of 2016 will be held in Bari, a beautiful city on the Adriatic coast of Southern Italy.
The hotel Villa Romanazzi Carducci, with its liberty-period villa immersed in a beautiful park characterized by a variety of trees along various pathways, provides the right context for welcoming the AVI participants. Rock gardens, balustrades, statues and fountains, so typical of romantic gardens, are combined with a modern structure equipped with everything needed for an international conference. The hotel is close to the city center, the train station and the airport shuttle.
To begin chatting with someone go to the contacts card and press on a contact.
To create a chatting group press on the button down below.
Check out the list of events through the menu on the left and choose the events to be saved in your calendar.
